title: Climate Change Cascades Drought | Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Ireland
description:
With all the rain we’ve had lately, it’s hard to picture a drought in Ireland! But they do happen and are predicted to become more frequent in the future.

Welcome to our Climate Cascades series, where we share illustrative ways that climate impacts such as drought can ripple out to impact other aspects of our lives. You might be surprised to see how far that impact travels! Stay with us, we know it’s a lot of arrows ⬆️⬅️↪️

This work comes from the EPA report the National Climate Change Risk Assessment, which lays out the risks associated with a changing climate in Ireland. Learn more: https://lnkd.in/eeU5b8hg

#ClimateChange #ClimateAdaptation

name: EPA Rollbacks
title: EPA Approves Pesticides Containing “Forever Chemicals” and Rolls Back Drinking Water Standards
description: The Environmental Protection Agency has approved the use of two new pesticides that contain fluorinated substances commonly referred to as “forever chemicals” because they take centuries to break down in the environment. The EPA also announced it is relaxing a rule mandating that companies report products containing the chemicals, and proposed further weakening limits in drinking water. For decades, forever chemicals have been used to produce countless industrial and consumer goods, even though they have been linked to cancer and birth defects for over half a century.
